channel.title: Post Your Dream PC
channel.description:
What would be your dream PC? As in, if you had unlimited resources and you could put together the ultimate rig? Mine would be something like this:
[url=https://pcpartpicker.com/p/fwfJ]PCPartPicker part list[/url] / [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/p/fwfJ/by_merchant/]Price breakdown by merchant[/url] / [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/p/fwfJ/benchmarks/]Benchmarks[/url]
[b]CPU:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/intel-cpu-bx80619i73960x]Intel Core i7 Extreme i7-3960X 3.3GHz 6-Core Processor[/url] ($1029.99 @ Newegg) [b]CPU Cooler:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/corsair-cpu-cooler-cwch100]Corsair H100 92.0 CFM Liquid CPU Cooler[/url] ($114.99 @ Newegg) [b]Motherboard:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/asus-motherboard-rampageivformula]Asus Rampage IV Formula ATX LGA2011 Motherboard[/url] ($369.99 @ Newegg) [b]Memory:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/corsair-memory-cmz16gx3m4a1600c9]Corsair Vengeance 16GB (4 x 4GB) DDR3-1600 Memory[/url] ($91.99 @ Newegg) [b]Storage:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/seagate-internal-hard-drive-st310005n1a1asrk]Seagate Barracuda 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive[/url] ($92.99 @ Newegg) [b]Storage:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/corsair-internal-hard-drive-cssdf90gb3bk]Corsair Force Series 3 90GB 2.5" Solid State Disk[/url] ($84.99 @ Newegg) [b]Video Card:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/gigabyte-video-card-gvn670oc2gd]Gigabyte GeForce GTX 670 2GB Video Card[/url] (2-Way SLI) ($399.99 @ Newegg) [b]Video Card:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/gigabyte-video-card-gvn670oc2gd]Gigabyte GeForce GTX 670 2GB Video Card[/url] (2-Way SLI) ($399.99 @ Newegg) [b]Sound Card:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/creative-labs-sound-card-70sb135600000]Creative Labs Recon3D Fatal1ty Professional 24-bit 96 KHz Sound Card[/url] ($157.67 @ Newegg) [b]Case:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/corsair-case-cc800dw]Corsair Obsidian Series 800D ATX Full Tower Case[/url] ($249.99 @ Newegg) [b]Power Supply:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/corsair-power-supply-cmpsu1200ax]Corsair 1200W ATX12V / EPS12V Power Supply[/url] ($290.98 @ Newegg) [b]Optical Drive:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/lite-on-optical-drive-ihbs11204]Lite-On IHBS112-04 Blu-Ray/DVD/CD Writer[/url] ($69.99 @ Newegg) [b]Operating System:[/b] [url=https://pcpartpicker.com/part/microsoft-os-gfc02050]Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium SP1 (64-bit)[/url] ($99.99 @ Newegg) [b]Total:[/b] $3453.54 [i](Prices include shipping and discounts when available.)[/i] [i](Generated by PCPartPicker 2012-08-24 11:02 EDT-0400)[/i]

item.title: Post Your Dream PC
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
My dream PC would never allow a piece of software to crash. It would have an OS capable of taking faulty programs/games and rewriting those parts to prevent it from ever happening, as well as have a fallback to never allow it to attempt a hostile takeover of the planet. And what Xal said.

Read full topic

item.title: Post Your Dream PC
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
My dream PC would upgrade itself according to needs and never overheat.

Read full topic

item.title: Post Your Dream PC
item.dc:creator: av3nger
item.description:
LordDz:

First, it would stop all wars and teach people about loving themselves and others.
Then it would allow me to fly anywhere I wanted, without using expensive fuel.

Then it would allow me to create anything I wanted in a matter of seconds, all through energy like in Star Trek. Also, it should have a cup holder.
That’s my dream PC.

Nicely said, don’t pour too hot of coffee! Or maybe you could microwave with it…:freeman:

Read full topic

item.title: Post Your Dream PC
item.dc:creator: MRPolo
item.description:
A cup holder. I don’t care about the specs, it needs a frickin’ cup holder… And a hammer with a tag above it “In case of losing, smash the monitor and ragequit”.

Read full topic

item.title: Post Your Dream PC
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Having 1TB+ SSDs would be cool. i7s don’t help with gaming so I wouldn’t really care for one of those. I have an i5 and a 670 so my PC is pretty cool. Kind of wish I had another case though. Mines has really good cooling but putting in HDDs and some other stuff is kind of difficult with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Post Your Dream PC
item.dc:creator: lunertexcosmo
item.description:
What would be your dream PC? As in, if you had unlimited resources and you could put together the ultimate rig? Mine would be something like this:

PCPartPicker part list / Price breakdown by merchant / Benchmarks

CPU: Intel Core i7 Extreme i7-3960X 3.3GHz 6-Core Processor ($1029.99 @ Newegg)
CPU Cooler: Corsair H100 92.0 CFM Liquid CPU Cooler ($114.99 @ Newegg)
Motherboard: Asus Rampage IV Formula ATX LGA2011 Motherboard ($369.99 @ Newegg)
Memory: Corsair Vengeance 16GB (4 x 4GB) DDR3-1600 Memory ($91.99 @ Newegg)
Storage: Seagate Barracuda 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive ($92.99 @ Newegg)
Storage: Corsair Force Series 3 90GB 2.5" Solid State Disk ($84.99 @ Newegg)
Video Card: Gigabyte GeForce GTX 670 2GB Video Card (2-Way SLI) ($399.99 @ Newegg)
Video Card: Gigabyte GeForce GTX 670 2GB Video Card (2-Way SLI) ($399.99 @ Newegg)
Sound Card: Creative Labs Recon3D Fatal1ty Professional 24-bit 96 KHz Sound Card ($157.67 @ Newegg)
Case: Corsair Obsidian Series 800D ATX Full Tower Case ($249.99 @ Newegg)
Power Supply: Corsair 1200W ATX12V / EPS12V Power Supply ($290.98 @ Newegg)
Optical Drive: Lite-On IHBS112-04 Blu-Ray/DVD/CD Writer ($69.99 @ Newegg)
Operating System: Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium SP1 (64-bit) ($99.99 @ Newegg)
Total: $3453.54
(Prices include shipping and discounts when available.)
